{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fovea palatinae are small pits or depressions in the hard palate, located at the junction of the hard and soft palate. They are not structures through which blood supply takes place, so option A is incorrect. They are not mucosal salivary glands, so option B is incorrect. They are not related to the termination of maxillary denture, so option C is incorrect. They are found in every individual, so option D is correct.", "answer_choice": "D"}
